College Hill (Pullman, WA) Association Master Plan
titlestmt.author: James Feller

repository.corpname: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

did.unittitle: College Hill (Pullman, WA) Association Master Plan
did.abstract: This collection consists of the master plan of the College Hill Association (CHA) in Pullman, WA.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single item, the master plan of the College Hill Association (Pullman, WA), created in 2005.

bioghist.p: The College Hill Association formed as a nonprofit organization in 1992 with the goal to revitalize the College Hill district of Pullman, Washington, near the campus of Washington State University. By partnering with student renters and Greek houses, the organization sought to create a community movement to improve the area. The CHA also worked with the WSU administration to cooperate on projects in the area.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

processinfo.p: James Feller processed this collection in 2018.

acqinfo.p: Bobbie Ryder of Washington State University Capital Planning transferred this collection to the WSU Libraries in 2006 (MS.2006.26).

prefercite.p: College Hill (Pullman, WA) Association Master Plan, 2005; Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries; Pullman, WA.
